meanings.definition: To make or become black in color.
meanings.sent1: The fire's smoke was blackening the walls of the house.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the book out in the sun caused its cover to start blackening.
meanings.sent3: The naughty child tried blackening his sister's drawing with a marker.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were blackening the sky, signaling an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes expertly captured the process of blackening the canvas.

meanings.definition: The process of cooking food with a spice rub that forms a dark crust on the outside.
meanings.sent1: The chef's specialty was Cajun blackening on fish fillets.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of blackening chicken filled the kitchen during dinner preparation.
meanings.sent3: The family eagerly awaited the delicious blackening of the steak on the grill.
meanings.sent4: The sizzle of the blackening shrimp on the hot skillet was music to the ears.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant's signature dish was the blackening of the catfish.

meanings.definition: The act of tarnishing someone's reputation.
meanings.sent1: Gossip can lead to the blackening of a person's character.
meanings.sent2: The politician's opponents engaged in a campaign of blackening his name.
meanings.sent3: The tabloid's exaggerated stories were aimed at blackening the celebrity's image.
meanings.sent4: The internet rumor mill was busy blackening the influencer's reputation.
meanings.sent5: The rivalry between the two companies resulted in the blackening of each other's brands.
